text: is there a good way to get the julia code from a given function name? `@which` is feasible but maybe hacky?

elements.text: is there a good way to get the julia code from a given function name?
@which
is feasible but maybe hacky?

text: Generally speaking, function name isn't sufficient, you need also the type of the arguments

elements.text: Generally speaking, function name isn't sufficient, you need also the type of the arguments
Take a look at CodeTracking.jl

text:
Code tracking has some fancier stuff but its very similar to whats in Base. This will work though thank you!
Also, Mose you are absolutely right.
Also^2 : how do I get the e key so I can type your name appropriately?

text:
On Ubuntu you can set a key to make accents and do something like Ctrl Right -> e -> `
You need to enable it somewhere

text: On iPhone and iPad, using the onscreen keyboard with U.S. English layout, you can long-press on the `e`, and it pops up with multiple options, including `è`

text: I use swiftkey on Android and I can insert accented letters by long-pressing, but most of the time I don't need to explicitly type them thanks to autocompletion (I basically never have to)
